punctuation: Wow... did you hear that? It sounded like a whisper—wait, no, it's just the wind. Or is it?!
number: There are 206 bones in the human body, 8 planets in the solar system, and about 37.2 trillion cells in an average human being.
quote: Dream big, work hard, stay focused, and surround yourself with good people. The journey may be tough, but the reward is worth it.
normal: The Great Wall of China stretches over 13,000 miles and was built over several dynasties to protect against invasions.

punctuation: Hey! Did you see that? No way-tell me I'm not imagining things!
number: The Eiffel Tower is 330 meters tall, and it takes 1,665 steps to reach the top if you're climbing on foot.
quote: Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will. Believe in yourself, and take that first step.
normal: Mount Everest, the tallest mountain in the world, stands at 8,848.86 meters above sea level.

punctuation: Stop! Wait a minute... did you just solve that puzzle in record time?!
number: The human brain contains about 86 billion neurons, and it generates roughly 20 watts of power.
quote: A smooth sea never made a skilled sailor. Challenges shape you into the person you are meant to become.
normal: The Amazon Rainforest produces around 20% of the world's oxygen and is home to millions of species.

punctuation: Huh? Are you serious?! That's unbelievable—I need to see it to believe it!
number: The deepest part of the ocean, the Mariana Trench, reaches a depth of approximately 36,070 feet.
quote: Every great achievement was once considered impossible. Keep pushing forward.
normal: The Moon has no atmosphere, which means there is no wind or sound on its surface.

punctuation: Oh no... did you just drop your phone in the water? Quick, grab some rice!
number: Water makes up about 71% of the Earth's surface, and the human body is composed of roughly 60% water.
quote: Failure is the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.
normal: Jupiter, the largest planet in the solar system, has a Great Red Spot that is a storm larger than Earth.

punctuation: Yikes! That was a close one—almost thought we were going to fall!
number: The speed of sound in air is approximately 343 meters per second, depending on temperature and humidity.
quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
normal: The Library of Alexandria was one of the most significant libraries of the ancient world.

punctuation: Oh wow... this view is breathtaking! I can't believe we made it to the top.
number: The Milky Way galaxy is estimated to contain over 100 billion stars, and it's just one of trillions of galaxies in the universe.
quote: Great things never come from comfort zones. Step out, explore, and create your own path.
normal: Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still edible.

punctuation: Shh... did you hear that? It sounded like someone whispering our names!
number: The Earth's core is as hot as the surface of the Sun, reaching temperatures of around 5,700°C.
quote: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
normal: Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't! Botanically, a berry must have seeds inside the flesh.

punctuation: Haha! That was hilarious—I haven't laughed this hard in ages!
number: A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus. It takes 243 Earth days to rotate once but only 225 days to orbit the Sun.
quote: Don't let yesterday take up too much of today. Keep moving forward.
normal: Sharks have been around for over 400 million years, making them older than dinosaurs.

punctuation: Gasp! That's incredible—I never thought I'd see something like this in real life!
number: A blue whale's heart weighs about 400 pounds, and its heartbeat can be detected from 2 miles away.
quote: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.
normal: Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood, making them one of the most fascinating creatures in the ocean.
